title: US greenhouse gas emissions rise before Trump policies even kick in
subhead: CO₂ emissions from the world's second-largest polluter have started rising again due to a cold winter and the use of coal to power data centers. The consequences of Donald Trump's attacks on climate action are expected to soon make the situation even worse.

title: French PM to force budget through Parliament without a vote
The necessary showdown with Donald Trump
Trump isolated after trade escalation with Europe over Greenland
subhead: The president's threats could undermine the agreement reached by the United States and the European Union in the summer of 2025.

title: The Kurdish dream of autonomy in Syria ends
subhead: Under pressure from advancing government forces, the head of the Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF), Mazloum Abdi, signed an agreement with Syrian President Ahmed al-Sharaa formalizing the restoration of Damascus's authority over northeastern Syria.

title: Valentino Garavani, fashion designer who founded Valentino, dies at 93
subhead: Renowned for the elegance of his designs, Garavani made vibrant red his signature color. The dress he created for Jackie Kennedy for her wedding to Aristotle Onassis brought him international fame. He died on January 19 at the age of 93.

title: Jean Pisani-Ferry, economist: 'Is AI fueling a new wave of growth or a bubble?'
subhead: When two Nobel laureates disagree over the potential impact of artificial intelligence, it signals that the massive investments now underway carry risk, notes economist Jean Pisani-Ferry. Through its own savings, Europe is also exposed to those risks.

The strange airborne rescue of Gaza's donkeys, from Israel to Europe
subhead: Since 2022, Sharon Cohen, who runs an animal rescue group near Tel Aviv, has removed donkeys from Palestinian owners she accuses of mistreatment and sent them to shelters across Europe. The initiative has drawn outrage amid Gaza's deepening humanitarian crisis.

title: Istanbul's ultra-violent gangs tighten their grip on the city
subhead: In Turkey's major cities, criminal gangs made up of teenagers and young adults have grown rapidly in recent years, fueled by a boom in synthetic drug trafficking.

title: 'Why War?': How thinkers answer this heartbreaking question
subhead: Since the bloodbath of World War I, philosophers have repeatedly grappled with the question: Is war an irrepressible human urge, or the product of historical and social forces?
